history.content:
Interested in working with real-world clients on data analytics and machine learning projects? Want to help teach high schoolers the fundamentals of data science? 

 

Big Data at Berkeley is a data science organization dedicated to spreading data science principles to students throughout the Bay Area. We have 2 teams—education and projects. Our education division leads a 8-week data science bootcamp on campus for local high school students. We are also creating a completely online, self-paced “Introduction to Data Science” course and are looking for members to help develop the curriculum. Our projects division is working on developing cutting-edge data analytics projects with exciting, real-world clients. 


Our application deadline is Tuesday, February 2nd at 11:59 PM (PT). You can find the application at https://bd.berkeley.edu/apply/. We encourage you to also attend one of our two infosessions this week on January 27 (Wednesday) or January 31 (Sunday) to chat with our members about our mission, what we do as a club, and how you can get involved!

Please email bigdata.berkeley@gmail.com with any questions or visit our website at https://bd.berkeley.edu/. For more information on recruitment, feel free to follow our Facebook page: fb.me/bigdata.berkeley. We look forward to working with you!
history.subject: Data Science Consulting and Education | Big Data at Berkeley Recruitment
